objective:
Objective:

Learn the importance of assigning the ariaHasPopup property to buttons that trigger popups, menus, or lists.
task:
Task:

You are provided with two Buttons. The first one opens a Dialog and the second one a Menu.

Set up the most relevant ariaHasPopup value for each Button.
instruction1:
Instruction:

In the file /webapp/exercises/Exercise02_Dialog.fragment.xml add the ariaHasPopup property in the Button control.
instruction2:
Instruction:

In the file /webapp/exercises/Exercise02_Menu.fragment.xml add the ariaHasPopup property in the Button control.
howToTest:
How to test:

  • Use NVDA (Screen Reader) to inspect each Button. It should vocalize whether the Button opens a Dialog or a Menu.
  • In Chrome Inspector go to the Accessibility Tab and verify the value of hasPopup in Computed Properties.
helpCode1:
<Button
  id="idOpenDialogExercise02Button"
  text="{i18n>Exercise02.fragment.dialog.button.open}"
  icon="sap-icon://action"
  width="150px"
  //Take a look at ariaHasPopup property for sap.m.Button control
  press="onOpenDialogButtonExercise02Press"
/>
helpCode2:
<Button
  id="idOpenMenuExercise02Button"
  text="{i18n>Exercise02.fragment.menu.button.open}"
  icon="sap-icon://menu"
  width="150px"

/>
